official-title.#text: To direct the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a special resource study of the West Hunter Street Baptist Church in Atlanta, Georgia, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives September 15, 2014.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: West Hunter Street Baptist Church Study Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: West Hunter Street Baptist Church Study Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall conduct a special resource study of the historic West Hunter Street Baptist Church, located at 775 Martin Luther King Jr. Drive, SW., Atlanta, Georgia and the block on which the church is located.

text.#text: In conducting the study under subsection (a), the
evaluate the national significance of the site;
determine the suitability and feasibility of designating the area as a unit of the
consider other alternatives for preservation, protection, and interpretation of the site by Federal, State, or local governmental entities, or private and nonprofit organizations;
consult with interested Federal, State, or local governmental entities, private and nonprofit organizations or any other interested individuals;
identify cost estimates for any Federal acquisition, development, interpretation, operation, and maintenance associated with the alternatives;
consider the effect of the designation of the study area as a unit of the

existing commercial and recreational activities, including but not limited to hunting, fishing, and recreational shooting, and on the authorization, construction, operation, maintenance, or improvement of energy production and transmission infrastructure; and
the authority of State and local governments to manage those activities.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to influence or participate in local land use decisions (such as zoning) or place restrictions on non-Federal lands if the study area is designated a unit of the

text.#text: identify any authorities, including condemnation, that will compel or permit the
Upon commencement of the study, owners of private property adjacent to the area will be notified of the study’s commencement and scope.
The study required under subsection (a) shall be conducted in accordance with the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: National Park System General Authorities Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Park System General Authorities Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate

text.#text: Not later than 3 years after the date on which funds are first made available for the study under subsection (a), the
